problems.title: Count Total Nodes in AVL Tree
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given N integers. Insert them into an AVL Tree one by one.
After inserting all values, print the total number of nodes in the AVL Tree.

AVL Tree Rules:
- It is a self-balancing Binary Search Tree.
- After each insertion, the tree may perform rotations (LL, RR, LR, RL) to remain balanced.
- Duplicates will NOT appear in input, so you do not need to handle them.

This problem is simple because total nodes = N (since no deletion).
Your task mainly focuses on AVL insertion understanding.

Input Format
The first line contains integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print:
nodes: X
(where X is the total number of nodes inserted).

Example
Input:
4
10 20 30 40

Output:
nodes: 4

Explanation:
All nodes are inserted, AVL balancing occurs internally but node count = 4.
problems.examples:
Sample Input 1
4
10 20 30 40

Sample Output 1
nodes: 4

Sample Input 2
1
15

Sample Output 2
nodes: 1
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 1000
1 ≤ each value ≤ 10^6
All values are distinct.
